detaileddescription.para: Saves the last state and the last substate

memberdef.name: ltc_state
memberdef.initializer: = { .timer = 0, .statereq = LTC_STATE_NO_REQUEST, .state = LTC_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED, .substate = 0, .laststate = LTC_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED, .lastsubstate = 0, .adcModereq = LTC_ADCMODE_FAST_DCP0, .adcMode = LTC_ADCMODE_FAST_DCP0, .adcMeasChreq = LTC_ADCMEAS_UNDEFINED, .adcMeasCh = LTC_ADCMEAS_UNDEFINED, .numberOfMeasuredMux = 32, .triggerentry = 0, .ErrRetryCounter = 0, .ErrRequestCounter = 0, .VoltageSampleTime = 0, .muxSampleTime = 0, .commandDataTransferTime = 3, .commandTransferTime = 3, .gpioClocksTransferTime = 3, .muxmeas_seqptr = NULL_PTR, .muxmeas_seqendptr = NULL_PTR, .muxmeas_nr_end = 0, .first_measurement_made = FALSE, .ltc_muxcycle_finished = E_NOT_OK, .check_spi_flag = FALSE, .balance_control_done = FALSE, }

detaileddescription.para: sets the internal data pointer of the temperature sensor (address 0x48) to 0x00
reads two data bytes from the temperature sensor
reads one data byte from the port expander
All cells, normal mode, discharge not permitted (DCP=0)
All cells, normal mode, discharge permitted (DCP=1)
All cells, filtered mode, discharge not permitted (DCP=0)
All cells, filtered mode, discharge permitted (DCP=1)
All cells, fast mode, discharge not permitted (DCP=0)
All cells, fast mode, discharge permitted (DCP=1)
Two cells (1 and 7), fast mode, discharge not permitted (DCP=0)
Single channel, GPIO 1, normal mode
Single channel, GPIO 1, filtered mode
Single channel, GPIO 1, fast mode
Single channel, GPIO 2, normal mode
Single channel, GPIO 2, filtered mode
Single channel, GPIO 2, fast mode
Single channel, GPIO 3, normal mode
Single channel, GPIO 3, filtered mode
Single channel, GPIO 3, fast mode
All channels, normal mode
All channels, filtered mode
All channels, fast mode

briefdescription.para: converts a raw voltage from multiplexer to a temperature value in Celsius.

detaileddescription.para: The temperatures are read from NTC elements via voltage dividers. This function implements the look-up table between voltage and temperature, taking into account the NTC characteristics and the voltage divider.

parameterdescription.para: voltage read from the multiplexer in V

briefdescription.para: in the database, initializes the fields related to the LTC drivers.

detaileddescription.para: This function loops through all the LTC-related data fields in the database and sets them to 0. It should be called in the initialization or re-initialization routine of the LTC driver.

briefdescription.para: stores the measured balancing feedback values in the database.

detaileddescription.para: This function stores the global balancing feedback value measured on GPIO3 of the LTC into the database

briefdescription.para: gets the balancing orders from the database.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the balancing control from the database. Balancing control is set by the BMS. The LTC driver only executes the balancing orders.

briefdescription.para: tells the LTC daisy-chain to start measuring the voltage on all cells.

detaileddescription.para: This function sends an instruction to the daisy-chain via SPI, in order to start voltage measurement for all cells.

parameterdescription.para: LTC ADCmeasurement mode (fast, normal or filtered)
number of cell voltage measured (2 cells or all cells)

simplesect.para: retVal E_OK if dummy byte was sent correctly by SPI, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: tells LTC daisy-chain to start measuring the voltage on GPIOS.

detaileddescription.para: This function sends an instruction to the daisy-chain via SPI to start the measurement.

parameterdescription.para: LTC ADCmeasurement mode (fast, normal or filtered)
number of channels measured for GPIOS (one at a time, typically when multiplexers are used, or all five GPIOs)

simplesect.para: retVal E_OK if dummy byte was sent correctly by SPI, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: brief missing

detaileddescription.para: Gets the measurement time needed by the LTC chip, depending on the measurement mode and the number of channels. For all cell voltages or all 5 GPIOS, the measurement time is the same. For 2 cell voltages or 1 GPIO, the measurement time is the same. As a consequence, this function is used for cell voltage and for GPIO measurement.

parameterdescription.para: LTC ADCmeasurement mode (fast, normal or filtered)
number of channels measured for GPIOS (one at a time for multiplexers or all five GPIOs) or number of cell voltage measured (2 cells or all cells)

briefdescription.para: saves the voltage values read from the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: After a voltage measurement was initiated to measure the voltages of the cells, the result is read via SPI from the daisy-chain. There are 6 register to read _(A,B,C,D,E,F) to get all cell voltages. Only one register can be read at a time. This function is called to store the result from the transmission in a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: voltage register that was read (voltage register A,B,C,D,E or F)
buffer containing the data obtained from the SPI transmission

briefdescription.para: checks if the data received from the daisy-chain is not corrupt.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the PEC (CRC) from the data received by the daisy-chain. It compares it with the PEC sent by the LTCs. If there are errors, the array LTC_ErrorTable is updated to locate the LTCs in daisy-chain that transmitted corrupt data.

parameterdescription.para: data obtained from the SPI transmission

simplesect.para: retVal E_OK if PEC check is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: send command to the LTC daisy-chain and receives data from the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This is the core function to receive data from the LTC6804 daisy-chain. A 2 byte command is sent with the corresponding PEC. Example: read configuration register (RDCFG). Only command has to be set, the function calculates the PEC automatically. The data send is: 2 bytes (COMMAND) 2 bytes (PEC) The data received is: 6 bytes (LTC1) 2 bytes (PEC) + 6 bytes (LTC2) 2 bytes (PEC) + 6 bytes (LTC3) 2 bytes (PEC) + ... + 6 bytes (LTC{LTC_N_LTC}) 2 bytes (PEC)
The function does not check the PECs. This has to be done elsewhere.

parameterdescription.para: command sent to the daisy-chain
data to sent to the daisy-chain, i.e. data to be sent + PEC

simplesect.para: statusSPI E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: sends command and data to the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This is the core function to transmit data to the LTC6804 daisy-chain. The data sent is: COMMAND + 6 bytes (LTC1) + 6 bytes (LTC2) + 6 bytes (LTC3) + ... + 6 bytes (LTC{LTC_N_LTC}) A 2 byte command is sent with the corresponding PEC. Example: write configuration register (WRCFG). THe command has to be set and then the function calculates the PEC automatically. The function calculates the needed PEC to send the data to the daisy-chain. The sent data has the format: 2 byte-COMMAND (2 bytes PEC) + 6 bytes (LTC1) (2 bytes PEC) + 6 bytes (LTC2) (2 bytes PEC) + 6 bytes (LTC3) (2 bytes PEC) + ... + 6 bytes (LTC{LTC_N_LTC}) (2 bytes PEC)
The function returns 0. The only way to check if the transmission was successful is to read the results of the write operation. (example: read configuration register after writing to it)

parameterdescription.para: command sent to the daisy-chain
data to be sent to the daisy-chain
data to sent to the daisy-chain, i.e. data to be sent + PEC (calculated by the function)

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: configures the data that will be sent to the LTC daisy-chain to configure multiplexer channels.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not sent the data to the multiplexer daisy-chain. This is done by the function LTC_SetMuxChannel(), which calls LTC_SetMUXChCommand()..

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels
multiplexer ID to be configured (0,1,2 or 3)
multiplexer channel to be configured (0 to 7)

briefdescription.para: sends data to the LTC daisy-chain to read EEPROM on slaves.

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels
data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels, with PEC (calculated by the function)
first or second stage of read process (0 or 1)
read address (18 bits)

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: configures the data that will be sent to the LTC daisy-chain to read EEPROM on slaves.

parameterdescription.para: first or second stage of read process (0 or 1)
data to be sent to the daisy-chain
read address (18 bits)

briefdescription.para: saves the read values of the external EEPROMs read from the LTC daisy-chain.

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing the data obtained from the SPI transmission

briefdescription.para: sends data to the LTC daisy-chain to write EEPROM on slaves.

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels
data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels, with PEC (calculated by the function)
first or second stage of read process (0 or 1)
read address (18 bits)

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: configures the data that will be sent to the LTC daisy-chain to write EEPROM on slaves.

parameterdescription.para: first or second stage of read process (0 or 1)
data to be sent to the daisy-chain
read address (18 bits)

briefdescription.para: sends data to the LTC daisy-chain to configure multiplexer channels.

detaileddescription.para: This function calls the function LTC_SetMUXChCommand() to set the data.

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels
data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels, with PEC (calculated by the function)
multiplexer ID to be configured (0,1,2 or 3)
multiplexer channel to be configured (0 to 7)

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: sends data to the LTC daisy-chain to control the user port expander

detaileddescription.para: This function sends a control byte to the register of the user port expander

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels
data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the multiplexer channels, with PEC (calculated by the function)

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: saves the received values of the external port expander read from the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This function saves the received data byte from the external port expander

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing the data obtained from the SPI transmission

briefdescription.para: saves the temperature value of the external temperature sensors read from the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This function saves the temperature value received from the external temperature sensors

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing the data obtained from the SPI transmission

briefdescription.para: sends 72 clock pulses to the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used for the communication with the multiplexers via I2C on the GPIOs. It send the command STCOMM to the LTC daisy-chain.

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain, set to 0xFF
data to be sent to the daisy-chain with PEC (calculated by the function)

simplesect.para: statusSPI E_OK if clock pulses were sent correctly by SPI, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: sends data to the LTC daisy-chain to communicate via I2C

detaileddescription.para: This function initiates an I2C signal sent by the LTC6804 on the slave boards

parameterdescription.para: data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the EEPROM
data to be sent to the daisy-chain to configure the EEPROM, with PEC (calculated by the function)
command data to be sent

simplesect.para: E_OK if SPI transmission is OK, E_NOT_OK otherwise

briefdescription.para: checks if the multiplexers acknowledged transmission.

detaileddescription.para: The RDCOMM command can be used to read the answer of the multiplexers to a I2C transmission. This function determines if the communication with the multiplexers was successful or not. The array LTC_ErrorTable is updated to locate the multiplexers that did not acknowledge transmission.

parameterdescription.para: data obtained from the SPI transmission
multiplexer to be addressed (multiplexer ID)

simplesect.para: mux_error 0 is there was no error, 1 if there was errors

briefdescription.para: saves the multiplexer values read from the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: After a voltage measurement was initiated on GPIO 1 to read the currently selected multiplexer voltage, the results is read via SPI from the daisy-chain. This function is called to store the result from the transmission in a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing the data obtained from the SPI transmission
pointer to the multiplexer sequence, which configures the currently selected multiplexer ID and channel

briefdescription.para: gets the frequency of the SPI clock.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads the configuration from the SPI handle directly.

briefdescription.para: sets the transfer time needed to receive/send data with the LTC daisy-chain.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the clock frequency and uses the number of LTCs in the daisy-chain.

briefdescription.para: checks the state requests that are made.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks the validity of the state requests. The resuls of the checked is returned immediately.

parameterdescription.para: state request to be checked

simplesect.para: result of the state request that was made, taken from LTC_RETURN_TYPE_e

briefdescription.para: stores the measured voltages in the database.

detaileddescription.para: This function loops through the data of all modules in the LTC daisy-chain that are stored in the LTC_CellVoltages buffer and writes them in the database. At each write iteration, the variable named "state" and related to voltages in the database is incremented.

briefdescription.para: stores the measured temperatures and the measured multiplexer feedbacks in the database.

detaileddescription.para: This function loops through the temperature and multiplexer feedback data of all modules in the LTC daisy-chain that are stored in the LTC_MultiplexerVoltages buffer and writes them in the database. At each write iteration, the variables named "state" and related to temperatures and multiplexer feedbacks in the database are incremented.

briefdescription.para: re-entrance check of LTC state machine trigger function

detaileddescription.para: This function is not re-entrant and should only be called time- or event-triggered. It increments the triggerentry counter from the state variable ltc_state. It should never be called by two different processes, so if it is the case, triggerentry should never be higher than 0 when this function is called.

simplesect.para: retval 0 if no further instance of the function is active, 0xff else

briefdescription.para: gets the current state request.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used in the functioning of the LTC state machine.

simplesect.para: retval current state request, taken from LTC_STATE_REQUEST_e

briefdescription.para: gets the current state.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used in the functioning of the LTC state machine.

briefdescription.para: transfers the current state request to the state machine.

detaileddescription.para: This function takes the current state request from ltc_state and transfers it to the state machine. It resets the value from ltc_state to LTC_STATE_NO_REQUEST

parameterdescription.para: bus ID, main or backup (deprecated)
LTC ADCmeasurement mode (fast, normal or filtered)
number of channels measured for GPIOS (one at a time for multiplexers or all five GPIOs)

simplesect.para: retVal current state request, taken from LTC_STATE_REQUEST_e

briefdescription.para: sets the current state request of the state variable ltc_state.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to make a state request to the state machine,e.g, start voltage measurement, read result of voltage measurement, re-initialization It calls LTC_CheckStateRequest() to check if the request is valid. The state request is rejected if is not valid. The result of the check is returned immediately, so that the requester can act in case it made a non-valid state request.

parameterdescription.para: state request to set
LTC ADCmeasurement mode (fast, normal or filtered)
number of channels measured for GPIOS (one at a time for multiplexers or all five GPIOs)
number of multiplexer inputs measured between two cell voltage measurements

simplesect.para: retVal current state request, taken from LTC_STATE_REQUEST_e

briefdescription.para: trigger function for the LTC driver state machine.

detaileddescription.para: This function contains the sequence of events in the LTC state machine. It must be called time-triggered, every 1ms.

briefdescription.para: gets the measurement initialization status.

simplesect.para: retval TRUE if a first measurement cycle was made, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: sets the measurement initialization status.
gets the measurement initialization status.

simplesect.para: retval TRUE if a first measurement cycle was made, FALSE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Driver for the LTC monitoring chip.
